comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From www.romecabs.com/tours/rome-in-a-day-from-civitavecchia/ "The pyramid was built about 18 BC-12 BC as a tomb for Gaius Cestius Epulo, a magistrate and member of one of the four great religious corporations in Rome, the Septemviri Epulonum." The pyramid was made of brick layered over concrete and then covered with slabs of white marble standing on a travertine foundation. The pyramid measures 100 Roman feet (22 m) square at the base and stands 125 Roman feet (27 m) high. See
